newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria exit poll shows 56.5 pct for UDF.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria exit poll shows 56.5 pct for UDF.

text.p: An exit poll conducted for Bulgaria's parliamentary election on Saturday shows the Union of Democratic Forces and its coalition allies with 56.5 percent of votes, Gallup polling agency said.
The poll of 7,000 voters gave the Socialists 19 percent and predicted three smaller parties would also enter parliament.
Gallup gave the Union for National Salvation coalition seven percent, the Euroleft six, and the Bulgarian Business Bloc 5.5 percent, all above the four percent threshold for entering parliament.
The vote for the UDF, which led month-long protests that toppled the former Socialist government in February, would be enough to give them an absolute majority in the 240-seat parliament.
A UDF victory had been widely predicted.
Another exit poll by Fakt agency gave similar results and put turnout at 70 percent, higher than for November's presidential election. Preliminary official results are expected early on Sunday.
